2232 inline R visit(const Visitor &v, V1 const &arg1) {
2233  return detail::VisitorApplicator<R>::apply(v, arg1);
2234 }
2235 
2236 template <typename R, typename Visitor, typename V1, typename V2>
2237 inline R visit(const Visitor &v, V1 const &arg1, V2 const &arg2) {
2238  return detail::VisitorApplicator<R>::apply(v, arg1, arg2);
2239 }
2240 
2241 template <typename R, typename Visitor, typename V1, typename V2, typename V3>
2242 inline R visit(const Visitor &v, V1 const &arg1, V2 const &arg2, V3 const &arg3) {
2243  return detail::VisitorApplicator<R>::apply(v, arg1, arg2, arg3);
2244 }
2245 
2246 template <typename R, typename Visitor, typename V1, typename V2, typename V3, typename V4>
2247 inline R visit(const Visitor &v, V1 const &arg1, V2 const &arg2, V3 const &arg3, V4 const &arg4) {
2248  return detail::VisitorApplicator<R>::apply(v, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4);
2249 }
2250 
2251 template <typename R, typename Visitor, typename V1, typename V2, typename V3, typename V4,
2252  typename V5>
2253 inline R visit(const Visitor &v, V1 const &arg1, V2 const &arg2, V3 const &arg3, V4 const &arg4,
2254  V5 const &arg5) {
2255  return detail::VisitorApplicator<R>::apply(v, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5);
2256 }
2257 
2258 #endif
2259 
2260 // 19.7.6 Relational operators
2261 
2262 namespace detail {
2263 
2264 template <class Variant> struct Comparator {
2265  static inline bool equal(Variant const &v, Variant const &w) {
2266  switch (v.index()) {
2267  case 0:
2268  return get<0>(v) == get<0>(w);
2269  case 1:
2270  return get<1>(v) == get<1>(w);
2271  case 2:
2272  return get<2>(v) == get<2>(w);
2273  case 3:
2274  return get<3>(v) == get<3>(w);
2275  case 4:
2276  return get<4>(v) == get<4>(w);
2277  case 5:
2278  return get<5>(v) == get<5>(w);
2279  case 6:
2280  return get<6>(v) == get<6>(w);
2281  case 7:
2282  return get<7>(v) == get<7>(w);
2283  case 8:
2284  return get<8>(v) == get<8>(w);
2285  case 9:
2286  return get<9>(v) == get<9>(w);
2287  case 10:
2288  return get<10>(v) == get<10>(w);
2289  case 11:
2290  return get<11>(v) == get<11>(w);
2291  case 12:
2292  return get<12>(v) == get<12>(w);
2293  case 13:
2294  return get<13>(v) == get<13>(w);
2295  case 14:
2296  return get<14>(v) == get<14>(w);
2297  case 15:
2298  return get<15>(v) == get<15>(w);
2299 
2300  default:
2301  return false;
2302  }
2303  }
2304 
2305  static inline bool less_than(Variant const &v, Variant const &w) {
2306  switch (v.index()) {
2307  case 0:
2308  return get<0>(v) < get<0>(w);
2309  case 1:
2310  return get<1>(v) < get<1>(w);
2311  case 2:
2312  return get<2>(v) < get<2>(w);
2313  case 3:
2314  return get<3>(v) < get<3>(w);
2315  case 4:
2316  return get<4>(v) < get<4>(w);
2317  case 5:
2318  return get<5>(v) < get<5>(w);
2319  case 6:
2320  return get<6>(v) < get<6>(w);
2321  case 7:
2322  return get<7>(v) < get<7>(w);
2323  case 8:
2324  return get<8>(v) < get<8>(w);
2325  case 9:
2326  return get<9>(v) < get<9>(w);
2327  case 10:
2328  return get<10>(v) < get<10>(w);
2329  case 11:
2330  return get<11>(v) < get<11>(w);
2331  case 12:
2332  return get<12>(v) < get<12>(w);
2333  case 13:
2334  return get<13>(v) < get<13>(w);
2335  case 14:
2336  return get<14>(v) < get<14>(w);
2337  case 15:
2338  return get<15>(v) < get<15>(w);
2339 
2340  default:
2341  return false;
2342  }
2343  }
2344 };
2345 
2346 } // namespace detail
2347 
2348 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2349  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2350 inline bool
2351 operator==(variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &v,
2352  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &w) {
2353  if (v.index() != w.index())
2354  return false;
2355  else if (v.valueless_by_exception())
2356  return true;
2357  else
2358  return detail::Comparator<
2359  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15>>::equal(v, w);
2360 }
2361 
2362 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2363  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2364 inline bool
2365 operator!=(variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &v,
2366  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &w) {
2367  return !(v == w);
2368 }
2369 
2370 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2371  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2372 inline bool
2373 operator<(variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &v,
2374  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &w) {
2375  if (w.valueless_by_exception())
2376  return false;
2377  else if (v.valueless_by_exception())
2378  return true;
2379  else if (v.index() < w.index())
2380  return true;
2381  else if (v.index() > w.index())
2382  return false;
2383  else
2384  return detail::Comparator<variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13,
2385  T14, T15>>::less_than(v, w);
2386 }
2387 
2388 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2389  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2390 inline bool
2391 operator>(variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &v,
2392  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &w) {
2393  return w < v;
2394 }
2395 
2396 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2397  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2398 inline bool
2399 operator<=(variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &v,
2400  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &w) {
2401  return !(v > w);
2402 }
2403 
2404 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2405  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2406 inline bool
2407 operator>=(variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &v,
2408  variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15> const &w) {
2409  return !(v < w);
2410 }
2411 
2412 } // namespace variants
2413 
2414 using namespace variants;
2415 
2416 } // namespace nonstd
2417 
2418 #if variant_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2419 
2420 // 19.7.12 Hash support
2421 
2422 namespace std {
2423 
2424 template <> struct hash<nonstd::monostate> {
2425  std::size_t operator()(nonstd::monostate) const variant_noexcept { return 42; }
2426 };
2427 
2428 template <class T0, class T1, class T2, class T3, class T4, class T5, class T6, class T7, class T8,
2429  class T9, class T10, class T11, class T12, class T13, class T14, class T15>
2430 struct hash<nonstd::variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13, T14, T15>> {
2431  std::size_t operator()(nonstd::variant<T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, T13,
2432  T14, T15> const &v) const variant_noexcept {
2433  namespace nvd = nonstd::variants::detail;
2434 
2435  switch (v.index()) {
2436  case 0:
2437  return nvd::hash(0) ^ nvd::hash(get<0>(v));
2438  case 1:
2439  return nvd::hash(1) ^ nvd::hash(get<1>(v));
2440  case 2:
2441  return nvd::hash(2) ^ nvd::hash(get<2>(v));
2442  case 3:
2443  return nvd::hash(3) ^ nvd::hash(get<3>(v));
2444  case 4:
2445  return nvd::hash(4) ^ nvd::hash(get<4>(v));
2446  case 5:
2447  return nvd::hash(5) ^ nvd::hash(get<5>(v));
2448  case 6:
2449  return nvd::hash(6) ^ nvd::hash(get<6>(v));
2450  case 7:
2451  return nvd::hash(7) ^ nvd::hash(get<7>(v));
2452  case 8:
2453  return nvd::hash(8) ^ nvd::hash(get<8>(v));
2454  case 9:
2455  return nvd::hash(9) ^ nvd::hash(get<9>(v));
2456  case 10:
2457  return nvd::hash(10) ^ nvd::hash(get<10>(v));
2458  case 11:
2459  return nvd::hash(11) ^ nvd::hash(get<11>(v));
2460  case 12:
2461  return nvd::hash(12) ^ nvd::hash(get<12>(v));
2462  case 13:
2463  return nvd::hash(13) ^ nvd::hash(get<13>(v));
2464  case 14:
2465  return nvd::hash(14) ^ nvd::hash(get<14>(v));
2466  case 15:
2467  return nvd::hash(15) ^ nvd::hash(get<15>(v));
2468 
2469  default:
2470  return 0;
2471  }
2472  }
2473 };
2474 
2475 } // namespace std
2476 
2477 #endif // variant_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2478 
2479 #if variant_BETWEEN(variant_COMPILER_MSVC_VER, 1300, 1900)
2480 #pragma warning(pop)
2481 #endif
2482 
2483 #endif // variant_USES_STD_VARIANT
2484 
2485 #endif // NONSTD_VARIANT_LITE_HPP
2486 //
2487 // Copyright (c) 2014-2018 Martin Moene
2488 //
2489 // https://github.com/martinmoene/optional-lite
2490 //
2491 // Distributed under the Boost Software License, Version 1.0.
2492 // (See accompanying file LICENSE.txt or copy at http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
2493 
2494 #pragma once
2495 
2496 #ifndef NONSTD_OPTIONAL_LITE_HPP
2497 #define NONSTD_OPTIONAL_LITE_HPP
2498 
2499 #define optional_lite_MAJOR 3
2500 #define optional_lite_MINOR 2
2501 #define optional_lite_PATCH 0
2502 
2503 #define optional_lite_VERSION \
2504  optional_STRINGIFY(optional_lite_MAJOR) "." optional_STRINGIFY( \
2505  optional_lite_MINOR) "." optional_STRINGIFY(optional_lite_PATCH)
2506 
2507 #define optional_STRINGIFY(x) optional_STRINGIFY_(x)
2508 #define optional_STRINGIFY_(x) #x
2509 
2510 // optional-lite configuration:
2511 
2512 #define optional_OPTIONAL_DEFAULT 0
2513 #define optional_OPTIONAL_NONSTD 1
2514 #define optional_OPTIONAL_STD 2
2515 
2516 #if !defined(optional_CONFIG_SELECT_OPTIONAL)
2517 #define optional_CONFIG_SELECT_OPTIONAL \
2518  (optional_HAVE_STD_OPTIONAL ? optional_OPTIONAL_STD : optional_OPTIONAL_NONSTD)
2519 #endif
2520 
2521 // Control presence of exception handling (try and auto discover):
2522 
2523 #ifndef optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2524 #if defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)
2525 #define optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS 0
2526 #else
2527 #define optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS 1
2528 #endif
2529 #endif
2530 
2531 // C++ language version detection (C++20 is speculative):
2532 // Note: VC14.0/1900 (VS2015) lacks too much from C++14.
2533 
2534 #ifndef optional_CPLUSPLUS
2535 #if defined(_MSVC_LANG) && !defined(__clang__)
2536 #define optional_CPLUSPLUS (_MSC_VER == 1900 ? 201103L : _MSVC_LANG)
2537 #else
2538 #define optional_CPLUSPLUS __cplusplus
2539 #endif
2540 #endif
2541 
2542 #define optional_CPP98_OR_GREATER (optional_CPLUSPLUS >= 199711L)
2543 #define optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER (optional_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L)
2544 #define optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ (optional_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L)
2545 #define optional_CPP14_OR_GREATER (optional_CPLUSPLUS >= 201402L)
2546 #define optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER (optional_CPLUSPLUS >= 201703L)
2547 #define optional_CPP20_OR_GREATER (optional_CPLUSPLUS >= 202000L)
2548 
2549 // C++ language version (represent 98 as 3):
2550 
2551 #define optional_CPLUSPLUS_V \
2552  (optional_CPLUSPLUS / 100 - (optional_CPLUSPLUS > 200000 ? 2000 : 1994))
2553 
2554 // Use C++17 std::optional if available and requested:
2555 
2556 #if optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER && defined(__has_include)
2557 #if __has_include(<optional> )
2558 #define optional_HAVE_STD_OPTIONAL 1
2559 #else
2560 #define optional_HAVE_STD_OPTIONAL 0
2561 #endif
2562 #else
2563 #define optional_HAVE_STD_OPTIONAL 0
2564 #endif
2565 
2566 #define optional_USES_STD_OPTIONAL \
2567  ((optional_CONFIG_SELECT_OPTIONAL == optional_OPTIONAL_STD) || \
2568  ((optional_CONFIG_SELECT_OPTIONAL == optional_OPTIONAL_DEFAULT) && optional_HAVE_STD_OPTIONAL))
2569 
2570 //
2571 // in_place: code duplicated in any-lite, expected-lite, optional-lite, value-ptr-lite,
2572 // variant-lite:
2573 //
2574 
2575 #ifndef nonstd_lite_HAVE_IN_PLACE_TYPES
2576 #define nonstd_lite_HAVE_IN_PLACE_TYPES 1
2577 
2578 // C++17 std::in_place in <utility>:
2579 
2580 #if optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER
2581 
2582 #include <utility>
2583 
2584 namespace nonstd {
2585 
2586 using std::in_place;
2587 using std::in_place_index;
2588 using std::in_place_index_t;
2589 using std::in_place_t;
2590 using std::in_place_type;
2591 using std::in_place_type_t;
2592 
2593 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_t(T) std::in_place_t
2594 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_type_t(T) std::in_place_type_t<T>
2595 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_index_t(K) std::in_place_index_t<K>
2596 
2597 #define nonstd_lite_in_place(T) \
2598  std::in_place_t {}
2599 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_type(T) \
2600  std::in_place_type_t<T> {}
2601 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_index(K) \
2602  std::in_place_index_t<K> {}
2603 
2604 } // namespace nonstd
2605 
2606 #else // optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER
2607 
2608 #include <cstddef>
2609 
2610 namespace nonstd {
2611 namespace detail {
2612 
2613 template <class T> struct in_place_type_tag {};
2614 
2615 template <std::size_t K> struct in_place_index_tag {};
2616 
2617 } // namespace detail
2618 
2619 struct in_place_t {};
2620 
2621 template <class T>
2622 inline in_place_t
2623 in_place(detail::in_place_type_tag<T> /*unused*/ = detail::in_place_type_tag<T>()) {
2624  return in_place_t();
2625 }
2626 
2627 template <std::size_t K>
2628 inline in_place_t
2629 in_place(detail::in_place_index_tag<K> /*unused*/ = detail::in_place_index_tag<K>()) {
2630  return in_place_t();
2631 }
2632 
2633 template <class T>
2634 inline in_place_t
2635 in_place_type(detail::in_place_type_tag<T> /*unused*/ = detail::in_place_type_tag<T>()) {
2636  return in_place_t();
2637 }
2638 
2639 template <std::size_t K>
2640 inline in_place_t
2641 in_place_index(detail::in_place_index_tag<K> /*unused*/ = detail::in_place_index_tag<K>()) {
2642  return in_place_t();
2643 }
2644 
2645 // mimic templated typedef:
2646 
2647 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_t(T) nonstd::in_place_t (&)(nonstd::detail::in_place_type_tag<T>)
2648 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_type_t(T) nonstd::in_place_t (&)(nonstd::detail::in_place_type_tag<T>)
2649 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_index_t(K) \
2650  nonstd::in_place_t (&)(nonstd::detail::in_place_index_tag<K>)
2651 
2652 #define nonstd_lite_in_place(T) nonstd::in_place_type<T>
2653 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_type(T) nonstd::in_place_type<T>
2654 #define nonstd_lite_in_place_index(K) nonstd::in_place_index<K>
2655 
2656 } // namespace nonstd
2657 
2658 #endif // optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER
2659 #endif // nonstd_lite_HAVE_IN_PLACE_TYPES
2660 
2661 //
2662 // Using std::optional:
2663 //
2664 
2665 #if optional_USES_STD_OPTIONAL
2666 
2667 #include <optional>
2668 
2669 namespace nonstd {
2670 
2671 using std::bad_optional_access;
2672 using std::hash;
2673 using std::optional;
2674 
2675 using std::nullopt;
2676 using std::nullopt_t;
2677 
2678 using std::operator==;
2679 using std::operator!=;
2680 using std::operator<;
2681 using std::operator<=;
2682 using std::operator>;
2683 using std::operator>=;
2684 using std::make_optional;
2685 using std::swap;
2686 } // namespace nonstd
2687 
2688 #else // optional_USES_STD_OPTIONAL
2689 
2690 #include <cassert>
2691 #include <utility>
2692 
2693 // optional-lite alignment configuration:
2694 
2695 #ifndef optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
2696 #define optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK 0
2697 #endif
2698 
2699 #ifndef optional_CONFIG_ALIGN_AS
2700 // no default, used in #if defined()
2701 #endif
2702 
2703 #ifndef optional_CONFIG_ALIGN_AS_FALLBACK
2704 #define optional_CONFIG_ALIGN_AS_FALLBACK double
2705 #endif
2706 
2707 // Compiler warning suppression:
2708 
2709 #if defined(__clang__)
2710 #pragma clang diagnostic push
2711 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wundef"
2712 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
2713 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
2714 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wundef"
2715 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
2716 #pragma warning(push)
2717 #endif
2718 
2719 // half-open range [lo..hi):
2720 #define optional_BETWEEN(v, lo, hi) ((lo) <= (v) && (v) < (hi))
2721 
2722 // Compiler versions:
2723 //
2724 // MSVC++ 6.0 _MSC_VER == 1200 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 60 (Visual Studio 6.0)
2725 // MSVC++ 7.0 _MSC_VER == 1300 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 70 (Visual Studio .NET 2002)
2726 // MSVC++ 7.1 _MSC_VER == 1310 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 71 (Visual Studio .NET 2003)
2727 // MSVC++ 8.0 _MSC_VER == 1400 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 80 (Visual Studio 2005)
2728 // MSVC++ 9.0 _MSC_VER == 1500 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 90 (Visual Studio 2008)
2729 // MSVC++ 10.0 _MSC_VER == 1600 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 100 (Visual Studio 2010)
2730 // MSVC++ 11.0 _MSC_VER == 1700 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 110 (Visual Studio 2012)
2731 // MSVC++ 12.0 _MSC_VER == 1800 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 120 (Visual Studio 2013)
2732 // MSVC++ 14.0 _MSC_VER == 1900 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 140 (Visual Studio 2015)
2733 // MSVC++ 14.1 _MSC_VER >= 1910 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 141 (Visual Studio 2017)
2734 // MSVC++ 14.2 _MSC_VER >= 1920 optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION == 142 (Visual Studio 2019)
2735 
2736 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__)
2737 #define optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER (_MSC_VER)
2738 #define optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION (_MSC_VER / 10 - 10 * (5 + (_MSC_VER < 1900)))
2739 #else
2740 #define optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER 0
2741 #define optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION 0
2742 #endif
2743 
2744 #define optional_COMPILER_VERSION(major, minor, patch) (10 * (10 * (major) + (minor)) + (patch))
2745 
2746 #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__)
2747 #define optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION \
2748  optional_COMPILER_VERSION(__GNUC__, __GNUC_MINOR__, __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)
2749 #else
2750 #define optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION 0
2751 #endif
2752 
2753 #if defined(__clang__)
2754 #define optional_COMPILER_CLANG_VERSION \
2755  optional_COMPILER_VERSION(__clang_major__, __clang_minor__, __clang_patchlevel__)
2756 #else
2757 #define optional_COMPILER_CLANG_VERSION 0
2758 #endif
2759 
2760 #if optional_BETWEEN(optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION, 70, 140)
2761 #pragma warning(disable : 4345) // initialization behavior changed
2762 #endif
2763 
2764 #if optional_BETWEEN(optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION, 70, 150)
2765 #pragma warning(disable : 4814) // in C++14 'constexpr' will not imply 'const'
2766 #endif
2767 
2768 // Presence of language and library features:
2769 
2770 #define optional_HAVE(FEATURE) (optional_HAVE_##FEATURE)
2771 
2772 #ifdef _HAS_CPP0X
2773 #define optional_HAS_CPP0X _HAS_CPP0X
2774 #else
2775 #define optional_HAS_CPP0X 0
2776 #endif
2777 
2778 // Unless defined otherwise below, consider VC14 as C++11 for optional-lite:
2779 
2780 #if optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1900
2781 #undef optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2782 #define optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER 1
2783 #endif
2784 
2785 #define optional_CPP11_90 (optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1500)
2786 #define optional_CPP11_100 (optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1600)
2787 #define optional_CPP11_110 (optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1700)
2788 #define optional_CPP11_120 (optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1800)
2789 #define optional_CPP11_140 (optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1900)
2790 #define optional_CPP11_141 (optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1910)
2791 
2792 #define optional_CPP11_140_490 \
2793  ((optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ && optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION >= 490) || \
2794  (optional_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1910))
2795 
2796 #define optional_CPP14_000 (optional_CPP14_OR_GREATER)
2797 #define optional_CPP17_000 (optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
2798 
2799 // Presence of C++11 language features:
2800 
2801 #define optional_HAVE_CONSTEXPR_11 optional_CPP11_140
2802 #define optional_HAVE_IS_DEFAULT optional_CPP11_140
2803 #define optional_HAVE_NOEXCEPT optional_CPP11_140
2804 #define optional_HAVE_NULLPTR optional_CPP11_100
2805 #define optional_HAVE_REF_QUALIFIER optional_CPP11_140_490
2806 #define optional_HAVE_INITIALIZER_LIST optional_CPP11_140
2807 
2808 // Presence of C++14 language features:
2809 
2810 #define optional_HAVE_CONSTEXPR_14 optional_CPP14_000
2811 
2812 // Presence of C++17 language features:
2813 
2814 #define optional_HAVE_NODISCARD optional_CPP17_000
2815 
2816 // Presence of C++ library features:
2817 
2818 #define optional_HAVE_CONDITIONAL optional_CPP11_120
2819 #define optional_HAVE_REMOVE_CV optional_CPP11_120
2820 #define optional_HAVE_TYPE_TRAITS optional_CPP11_90
2821 
2822 #define optional_HAVE_TR1_TYPE_TRAITS (!!optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION)
2823 #define optional_HAVE_TR1_ADD_POINTER (!!optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION)
2824 
2825 // C++ feature usage:
2826 
2827 #if optional_HAVE(CONSTEXPR_11)
2828 #define optional_constexpr constexpr
2829 #else
2830 #define optional_constexpr /*constexpr*/
2831 #endif
2832 
2833 #if optional_HAVE(IS_DEFAULT)
2834 #define optional_is_default = default;
2835 #else
2836 #define optional_is_default \
2837  {}
2838 #endif
2839 
2840 #if optional_HAVE(CONSTEXPR_14)
2841 #define optional_constexpr14 constexpr
2842 #else
2843 #define optional_constexpr14 /*constexpr*/
2844 #endif
2845 
2846 #if optional_HAVE(NODISCARD)
2847 #define optional_nodiscard [[nodiscard]]
2848 #else
2849 #define optional_nodiscard /*[[nodiscard]]*/
2850 #endif
2851 
2852 #if optional_HAVE(NOEXCEPT)
2853 #define optional_noexcept noexcept
2854 #else
2855 #define optional_noexcept /*noexcept*/
2856 #endif
2857 
2858 #if optional_HAVE(NULLPTR)
2859 #define optional_nullptr nullptr
2860 #else
2861 #define optional_nullptr NULL
2862 #endif
2863 
2864 #if optional_HAVE(REF_QUALIFIER)
2865 // NOLINTNEXTLINE( bugprone-macro-parentheses )
2866 #define optional_ref_qual &
2867 #define optional_refref_qual &&
2868 #else
2869 #define optional_ref_qual /*&*/
2870 #define optional_refref_qual /*&&*/
2871 #endif
2872 
2873 // additional includes:
2874 
2875 #if optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2876 // already included: <cassert>
2877 #else
2878 #include <stdexcept>
2879 #endif
2880 
2881 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2882 #include <functional>
2883 #endif
2884 
2885 #if optional_HAVE(INITIALIZER_LIST)
2886 #include <initializer_list>
2887 #endif
2888 
2889 #if optional_HAVE(TYPE_TRAITS)
2890 #include <type_traits>
2891 #elif optional_HAVE(TR1_TYPE_TRAITS)
2892 #include <tr1/type_traits>
2893 #endif
2894 
2895 // Method enabling
2896 
2897 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2898 
2899 #define optional_REQUIRES_0(...) \
2900  template <bool B = (__VA_ARGS__), typename std::enable_if<B, int>::type = 0>
2901 
2902 #define optional_REQUIRES_T(...) , typename std::enable_if<(__VA_ARGS__), int>::type = 0
2903 
2904 #define optional_REQUIRES_R(R, ...) typename std::enable_if<(__VA_ARGS__), R>::type
2905 
2906 #define optional_REQUIRES_A(...) , typename std::enable_if<(__VA_ARGS__), void *>::type = nullptr
2907 
2908 #endif
2909 
2910 //
2911 // optional:
2912 //
2913 
2914 namespace nonstd {
2915 namespace optional_lite {
2916 
2917 namespace std11 {
2918 
2919 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2920 using std::move;
2921 #else
2922 template <typename T> T &move(T &t) { return t; }
2923 #endif
2924 
2925 #if optional_HAVE(CONDITIONAL)
2926 using std::conditional;
2927 #else
2928 template <bool B, typename T, typename F> struct conditional { typedef T type; };
2929 template <typename T, typename F> struct conditional<false, T, F> { typedef F type; };
2930 #endif // optional_HAVE_CONDITIONAL
2931 
2932 // gcc < 5:
2933 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2934 #if optional_BETWEEN(optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION, 1, 500)
2935 template <typename T> struct is_trivially_copy_constructible : std::true_type {};
2936 template <typename T> struct is_trivially_move_constructible : std::true_type {};
2937 #else
2938 using std::is_trivially_copy_constructible;
2939 using std::is_trivially_move_constructible;
2940 #endif
2941 #endif
2942 } // namespace std11
2943 
2944 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2945 
2947 
2948 namespace std17 {
2949 
2950 #if optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER
2951 
2952 using std::is_nothrow_swappable;
2953 using std::is_swappable;
2954 
2955 #elif optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2956 
2957 namespace detail {
2958 
2959 using std::swap;
2960 
2961 struct is_swappable {
2962  template <typename T, typename = decltype(swap(std::declval<T &>(), std::declval<T &>()))>
2963  static std::true_type test(int /*unused*/);
2964 
2965  template <typename> static std::false_type test(...);
2966 };
2967 
2968 struct is_nothrow_swappable {
2969  // wrap noexcept(expr) in separate function as work-around for VC140 (VS2015):
2970 
2971  template <typename T> static constexpr bool satisfies() {
2972  return noexcept(swap(std::declval<T &>(), std::declval<T &>()));
2973  }
2974 
2975  template <typename T>
2976  static auto test(int /*unused*/) -> std::integral_constant<bool, satisfies<T>()> {}
2977 
2978  template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
2979 };
2980 
2981 } // namespace detail
2982 
2983 // is [nothow] swappable:
2984 
2985 template <typename T> struct is_swappable : decltype(detail::is_swappable::test<T>(0)) {};
2986 
2987 template <typename T>
2988 struct is_nothrow_swappable : decltype(detail::is_nothrow_swappable::test<T>(0)) {};
2989 
2990 #endif // optional_CPP17_OR_GREATER
2991 
2992 } // namespace std17
2993 
2995 
2996 namespace std20 {
2997 
2998 template <typename T> struct remove_cvref {
2999  typedef typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type type;
3000 };
3001 
3002 } // namespace std20
3003 
3004 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3005 
3007 
3008 template <typename T> class optional;
3009 
3010 namespace detail {
3011 
3012 // C++11 emulation:
3013 
3014 struct nulltype {};
3015 
3016 template <typename Head, typename Tail> struct typelist {
3017  typedef Head head;
3018  typedef Tail tail;
3019 };
3020 
3021 #if optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
3022 
3023 // Max align, use most restricted type for alignment:
3024 
3025 #define optional_UNIQUE(name) optional_UNIQUE2(name, __LINE__)
3026 #define optional_UNIQUE2(name, line) optional_UNIQUE3(name, line)
3027 #define optional_UNIQUE3(name, line) name##line
3028 
3029 #define optional_ALIGN_TYPE(type) \
3030  type optional_UNIQUE(_t); \
3031  struct_t<type> optional_UNIQUE(_st)
3032 
3033 template <typename T> struct struct_t { T _; };
3034 
3035 union max_align_t {
3036  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(char);
3037  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(short int);
3038  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(int);
3039  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long int);
3040  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(float);
3041  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(double);
3042  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long double);
3043  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(char *);
3044  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(short int *);
3045  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(int *);
3046  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long int *);
3047  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(float *);
3048  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(double *);
3049  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long double *);
3050  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(void *);
3051 
3052 #ifdef HAVE_LONG_LONG
3053  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long long);
3054 #endif
3055 
3056  struct Unknown;
3057 
3058  Unknown (*optional_UNIQUE(_))(Unknown);
3059  Unknown *Unknown::*optional_UNIQUE(_);
3060  Unknown (Unknown::*optional_UNIQUE(_))(Unknown);
3061 
3062  struct_t<Unknown (*)(Unknown)> optional_UNIQUE(_);
3063  struct_t<Unknown * Unknown::*> optional_UNIQUE(_);
3064  struct_t<Unknown (Unknown::*)(Unknown)> optional_UNIQUE(_);
3065 };
3066 
3067 #undef optional_UNIQUE
3068 #undef optional_UNIQUE2
3069 #undef optional_UNIQUE3
3070 
3071 #undef optional_ALIGN_TYPE
3072 
3073 #elif defined(optional_CONFIG_ALIGN_AS) // optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
3074 
3075 // Use user-specified type for alignment:
3076 
3077 #define optional_ALIGN_AS(unused) optional_CONFIG_ALIGN_AS
3078 
3079 #else // optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
3080 
3081 // Determine POD type to use for alignment:
3082 
3083 #define optional_ALIGN_AS(to_align) \
3084  typename type_of_size<alignment_types, alignment_of<to_align>::value>::type
3085 
3086 template <typename T> struct alignment_of;
3087 
3088 template <typename T> struct alignment_of_hack {
3089  char c;
3090  T t;
3091  alignment_of_hack();
3092 };
3093 
3094 template <size_t A, size_t S> struct alignment_logic {
3095  enum { value = A < S ? A : S };
3096 };
3097 
3098 template <typename T> struct alignment_of {
3099  enum { value = alignment_logic<sizeof(alignment_of_hack<T>) - sizeof(T), sizeof(T)>::value };
3100 };
3101 
3102 template <typename List, size_t N> struct type_of_size {
3103  typedef
3104  typename std11::conditional<N == sizeof(typename List::head), typename List::head,
3105  typename type_of_size<typename List::tail, N>::type>::type type;
3106 };
3107 
3108 template <size_t N> struct type_of_size<nulltype, N> {
3109  typedef optional_CONFIG_ALIGN_AS_FALLBACK type;
3110 };
3111 
3112 template <typename T> struct struct_t { T _; };
3113 
3114 #define optional_ALIGN_TYPE(type) typelist < type, typelist < struct_t<type>
3115 
3116 struct Unknown;
3117 
3118 typedef optional_ALIGN_TYPE(char), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(short), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(int),
3119  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(float), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(double),
3120  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long double),
3121 
3122  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(char *), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(short *), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(int *),
3123  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long *), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(float *), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(double *),
3124  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(long double *),
3125 
3126  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(Unknown (*)(Unknown)), optional_ALIGN_TYPE(Unknown *Unknown::*),
3127  optional_ALIGN_TYPE(Unknown (Unknown::*)(Unknown)),
3128 
3129  nulltype >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> alignment_types;
3130 
3131 #undef optional_ALIGN_TYPE
3132 
3133 #endif // optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
3134 
3136 
3137 template <typename T> union storage_t {
3138  // private:
3139  // template< typename > friend class optional;
3140 
3141  typedef T value_type;
3142 
3143  storage_t() optional_is_default
3144 
3145  explicit storage_t(value_type const &v) {
3146  construct_value(v);
3147  }
3148 
3149  void construct_value(value_type const &v) { ::new (value_ptr()) value_type(v); }
3150 
3151 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3152 
3153  explicit storage_t(value_type &&v) { construct_value(std::move(v)); }
3154 
3155  void construct_value(value_type &&v) { ::new (value_ptr()) value_type(std::move(v)); }
3156 
3157  template <class... Args> void emplace(Args &&... args) {
3158  ::new (value_ptr()) value_type(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3159  }
3160 
3161  template <class U, class... Args> void emplace(std::initializer_list<U> il, Args &&... args) {
3162  ::new (value_ptr()) value_type(il, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3163  }
3164 
3165 #endif
3166 
3167  void destruct_value() { value_ptr()->~T(); }
3168 
3169  optional_nodiscard value_type const *value_ptr() const { return as<value_type>(); }
3170 
3171  value_type *value_ptr() { return as<value_type>(); }
3172 
3173  optional_nodiscard value_type const &value() const optional_ref_qual { return *value_ptr(); }
3174 
3175  value_type &value() optional_ref_qual { return *value_ptr(); }
3176 
3177 #if optional_HAVE(REF_QUALIFIER)
3178 
3179  optional_nodiscard value_type const &&value() const optional_refref_qual {
3180  return std::move(value());
3181  }
3182 
3183  value_type &&value() optional_refref_qual { return std::move(value()); }
3184 
3185 #endif
3186 
3187 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3188 
3189  using aligned_storage_t =
3190  typename std::aligned_storage<sizeof(value_type), alignof(value_type)>::type;
3191  aligned_storage_t data;
3192 
3193 #elif optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
3194 
3195  typedef struct {
3196  unsigned char data[sizeof(value_type)];
3197  } aligned_storage_t;
3198 
3199  max_align_t hack;
3200  aligned_storage_t data;
3201 
3202 #else
3203  typedef optional_ALIGN_AS(value_type) align_as_type;
3204 
3205  typedef struct {
3206  align_as_type data[1 + (sizeof(value_type) - 1) / sizeof(align_as_type)];
3207  } aligned_storage_t;
3208  aligned_storage_t data;
3209 
3210 #undef optional_ALIGN_AS
3211 
3212 #endif // optional_CONFIG_MAX_ALIGN_HACK
3213 
3214  optional_nodiscard void *ptr() optional_noexcept { return &data; }
3215 
3216  optional_nodiscard void const *ptr() const optional_noexcept { return &data; }
3217 
3218  template <typename U> optional_nodiscard U *as() { return reinterpret_cast<U *>(ptr()); }
3219 
3220  template <typename U> optional_nodiscard U const *as() const {
3221  return reinterpret_cast<U const *>(ptr());
3222  }
3223 };
3224 
3225 } // namespace detail
3226 
3228 
3229 struct nullopt_t {
3230  struct init {};
3231  explicit optional_constexpr nullopt_t(init /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {}
3232 };
3233 
3234 #if optional_HAVE(CONSTEXPR_11)
3235 constexpr nullopt_t nullopt{nullopt_t::init{}};
3236 #else
3237 // extra parenthesis to prevent the most vexing parse:
3238 const nullopt_t nullopt((nullopt_t::init()));
3239 #endif
3240 
3242 
3243 #if !optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3244 
3245 class bad_optional_access : public std::logic_error {
3246 public:
3247  explicit bad_optional_access() : logic_error("bad optional access") {}
3248 };
3249 
3250 #endif // optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3251 
3253 
3254 template <typename T> class optional {
3255 private:
3256  template <typename> friend class optional;
3257 
3258  typedef void (optional::*safe_bool)() const;
3259 
3260 public:
3261  typedef T value_type;
3262 
3263  // x.x.3.1, constructors
3264 
3265  // 1a - default construct
3266  optional_constexpr optional() optional_noexcept : has_value_(false), contained() {}
3267 
3268  // 1b - construct explicitly empty
3269  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( google-explicit-constructor, hicpp-explicit-conversions )
3270  optional_constexpr optional(nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept : has_value_(false),
3271  contained() {}
3272 
3273  // 2 - copy-construct
3274 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3275  // template< typename U = T
3276  // optional_REQUIRES_T(
3277  // std::is_copy_constructible<U>::value
3278  // || std11::is_trivially_copy_constructible<U>::value
3279  // )
3280  // >
3281 #endif
3282  optional_constexpr14 optional(optional const &other) : has_value_(other.has_value()) {
3283  if (other.has_value()) {
3284  contained.construct_value(other.contained.value());
3285  }
3286  }
3287 
3288 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3289 
3290  // 3 (C++11) - move-construct from optional
3291  template <typename U = T optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_move_constructible<U>::value ||
3292  std11::is_trivially_move_constructible<U>::value)>
3293  optional_constexpr14 optional(optional &&other)
3294  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( performance-noexcept-move-constructor )
3295  noexcept(std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<T>::value)
3296  : has_value_(other.has_value()) {
3297  if (other.has_value()) {
3298  contained.construct_value(std::move(other.contained.value()));
3299  }
3300  }
3301 
3302  // 4a (C++11) - explicit converting copy-construct from optional
3303  template <typename U optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_constructible<T, U const &>::value &&
3304  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
3305  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3306  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3307  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &&>::value &&
3308  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
3309  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
3310  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &, T>::value &&
3311  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &&, T>::value &&
3312  !std::is_convertible<U const &, T>::value /*=> explicit
3313  */
3314  )>
3315  explicit optional(optional<U> const &other) : has_value_(other.has_value()) {
3316  if (other.has_value()) {
3317  contained.construct_value(T{other.contained.value()});
3318  }
3319  }
3320 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3321 
3322  // 4b (C++98 and later) - non-explicit converting copy-construct from optional
3323  template <typename U
3324 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3325  optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_constructible<T, U const &>::value &&
3326  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
3327  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3328  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3329  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &&>::value &&
3330  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
3331  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
3332  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &, T>::value &&
3333  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &&, T>::value &&
3334  std::is_convertible<U const &, T>::value /*=> non-explicit */
3335  )
3336 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3337  >
3338  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( google-explicit-constructor, hicpp-explicit-conversions )
3339  /*non-explicit*/ optional(optional<U> const &other) : has_value_(other.has_value()) {
3340  if (other.has_value()) {
3341  contained.construct_value(other.contained.value());
3342  }
3343  }
3344 
3345 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3346 
3347  // 5a (C++11) - explicit converting move-construct from optional
3348  template <typename U optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_constructible<T, U &&>::value &&
3349  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
3350  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3351  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3352  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &&>::value &&
3353  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
3354  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
3355  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &, T>::value &&
3356  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &&, T>::value &&
3357  !std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value /*=> explicit */
3358  )>
3359  explicit optional(optional<U> &&other) : has_value_(other.has_value()) {
3360  if (other.has_value()) {
3361  contained.construct_value(T{std::move(other.contained.value())});
3362  }
3363  }
3364 
3365  // 5a (C++11) - non-explicit converting move-construct from optional
3366  template <typename U optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_constructible<T, U &&>::value &&
3367  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
3368  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3369  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3370  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &&>::value &&
3371  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
3372  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
3373  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &, T>::value &&
3374  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &&, T>::value &&
3375  std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value /*=> non-explicit */
3376  )>
3377  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( google-explicit-constructor, hicpp-explicit-conversions )
3378  /*non-explicit*/ optional(optional<U> &&other) : has_value_(other.has_value()) {
3379  if (other.has_value()) {
3380  contained.construct_value(std::move(other.contained.value()));
3381  }
3382  }
3383 
3384  // 6 (C++11) - in-place construct
3385  template <typename... Args optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_constructible<T, Args &&...>::value)>
3386  optional_constexpr explicit optional(nonstd_lite_in_place_t(T), Args &&... args)
3387  : has_value_(true), contained(T(std::forward<Args>(args)...)) {}
3388 
3389  // 7 (C++11) - in-place construct, initializer-list
3390  template <typename U,
3391  typename... Args optional_REQUIRES_T(
3392  std::is_constructible<T, std::initializer_list<U> &, Args &&...>::value)>
3393  optional_constexpr explicit optional(nonstd_lite_in_place_t(T), std::initializer_list<U> il,
3394  Args &&... args)
3395  : has_value_(true), contained(T(il, std::forward<Args>(args)...)) {}
3396 
3397  // 8a (C++11) - explicit move construct from value
3398  template <
3399  typename U = T optional_REQUIRES_T(
3400  std::is_constructible<T, U &&>::value &&
3401  !std::is_same<typename std20::remove_cvref<U>::type, nonstd_lite_in_place_t(U)>::value &&
3402  !std::is_same<typename std20::remove_cvref<U>::type, optional<T>>::value &&
3403  !std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value /*=> explicit */
3404  )>
3405  optional_constexpr explicit optional(U &&value)
3406  : has_value_(true), contained(T{std::forward<U>(value)}) {}
3407 
3408  // 8b (C++11) - non-explicit move construct from value
3409  template <
3410  typename U = T optional_REQUIRES_T(
3411  std::is_constructible<T, U &&>::value &&
3412  !std::is_same<typename std20::remove_cvref<U>::type, nonstd_lite_in_place_t(U)>::value &&
3413  !std::is_same<typename std20::remove_cvref<U>::type, optional<T>>::value &&
3414  std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value /*=> non-explicit */
3415  )>
3416  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( google-explicit-constructor, hicpp-explicit-conversions )
3417  optional_constexpr /*non-explicit*/ optional(U &&value)
3418  : has_value_(true), contained(std::forward<U>(value)) {}
3419 
3420 #else // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3421 
3422  // 8 (C++98)
3423  optional(value_type const &value) : has_value_(true), contained(value) {}
3424 
3425 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3426 
3427  // x.x.3.2, destructor
3428 
3429  ~optional() {
3430  if (has_value()) {
3431  contained.destruct_value();
3432  }
3433  }
3434 
3435  // x.x.3.3, assignment
3436 
3437  // 1 (C++98and later) - assign explicitly empty
3438  optional &operator=(nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3439  reset();
3440  return *this;
3441  }
3442 
3443  // 2 (C++98and later) - copy-assign from optional
3444 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3445  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( cppcoreguidelines-c-copy-assignment-signature,
3446  // misc-unconventional-assign-operator )
3447  optional_REQUIRES_R(optional &, true
3448  // std::is_copy_constructible<T>::value
3449  // && std::is_copy_assignable<T>::value
3450  )
3451  operator=(optional const &other) noexcept(
3452  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<T>::value &&std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<T>::value)
3453 #else
3454  optional &operator=(optional const &other)
3455 #endif
3456  {
3457  if ((has_value() == true) && (other.has_value() == false)) {
3458  reset();
3459  } else if ((has_value() == false) && (other.has_value() == true)) {
3460  initialize(*other);
3461  } else if ((has_value() == true) && (other.has_value() == true)) {
3462  contained.value() = *other;
3463  }
3464  return *this;
3465  }
3466 
3467 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3468 
3469  // 3 (C++11) - move-assign from optional
3470  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( cppcoreguidelines-c-copy-assignment-signature,
3471  // misc-unconventional-assign-operator )
3472  optional_REQUIRES_R(optional &, true
3473  // std::is_move_constructible<T>::value
3474  // && std::is_move_assignable<T>::value
3475  )
3476  operator=(optional &&other) noexcept {
3477  if ((has_value() == true) && (other.has_value() == false)) {
3478  reset();
3479  } else if ((has_value() == false) && (other.has_value() == true)) {
3480  initialize(std::move(*other));
3481  } else if ((has_value() == true) && (other.has_value() == true)) {
3482  contained.value() = std::move(*other);
3483  }
3484  return *this;
3485  }
3486 
3487  // 4 (C++11) - move-assign from value
3488  template <typename U = T>
3489  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( cppcoreguidelines-c-copy-assignment-signature,
3490  // misc-unconventional-assign-operator )
3491  optional_REQUIRES_R(
3492  optional &,
3493  std::is_constructible<T, U>::value &&std::is_assignable<T &, U>::value &&
3494  !std::is_same<typename std20::remove_cvref<U>::type, nonstd_lite_in_place_t(U)>::value &&
3495  !std::is_same<typename std20::remove_cvref<U>::type, optional<T>>::value &&
3496  !(std::is_scalar<T>::value && std::is_same<T, typename std::decay<U>::type>::value))
3497  operator=(U &&value) {
3498  if (has_value()) {
3499  contained.value() = std::forward<U>(value);
3500  } else {
3501  initialize(T(std::forward<U>(value)));
3502  }
3503  return *this;
3504  }
3505 
3506 #else // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3507 
3508  // 4 (C++98) - copy-assign from value
3509  template <typename U /*= T*/> optional &operator=(U const &value) {
3510  if (has_value())
3511  contained.value() = value;
3512  else
3513  initialize(T(value));
3514  return *this;
3515  }
3516 
3517 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3518 
3519  // 5 (C++98 and later) - converting copy-assign from optional
3520  template <typename U>
3521 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3522  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( cppcoreguidelines-c-copy-assignment-signature,
3523  // misc-unconventional-assign-operator )
3524  optional_REQUIRES_R(
3525  optional &,
3526  std::is_constructible<T, U const &>::value &&std::is_assignable<T &, U const &>::value &&
3527  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
3528  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3529  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3530  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &&>::value &&
3531  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
3532  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
3533  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &, T>::value &&
3534  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &&, T>::value &&
3535  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> &>::value &&
3536  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3537  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3538  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> const &&>::value)
3539 #else
3540  optional &
3541 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3542  operator=(optional<U> const &other) {
3543  return *this = optional(other);
3544  }
3545 
3546 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3547 
3548  // 6 (C++11) - converting move-assign from optional
3549  template <typename U>
3550  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( cppcoreguidelines-c-copy-assignment-signature,
3551  // misc-unconventional-assign-operator )
3552  optional_REQUIRES_R(optional &,
3553  std::is_constructible<T, U>::value &&std::is_assignable<T &, U>::value &&
3554  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
3555  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3556  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3557  !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> const &&>::value &&
3558  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
3559  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
3560  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &, T>::value &&
3561  !std::is_convertible<optional<U> const &&, T>::value &&
3562  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> &>::value &&
3563  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> &&>::value &&
3564  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> const &>::value &&
3565  !std::is_assignable<T &, optional<U> const &&>::value)
3566  operator=(optional<U> &&other) {
3567  return *this = optional(std::move(other));
3568  }
3569 
3570  // 7 (C++11) - emplace
3571  template <typename... Args optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_constructible<T, Args &&...>::value)>
3572  T &emplace(Args &&... args) {
3573  *this = nullopt;
3574  contained.emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3575  has_value_ = true;
3576  return contained.value();
3577  }
3578 
3579  // 8 (C++11) - emplace, initializer-list
3580  template <typename U,
3581  typename... Args optional_REQUIRES_T(
3582  std::is_constructible<T, std::initializer_list<U> &, Args &&...>::value)>
3583  T &emplace(std::initializer_list<U> il, Args &&... args) {
3584  *this = nullopt;
3585  contained.emplace(il, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3586  has_value_ = true;
3587  return contained.value();
3588  }
3589 
3590 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3591 
3592  // x.x.3.4, swap
3593 
3594  void swap(optional &other)
3595 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3596  noexcept(std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<T>::value &&std17::is_nothrow_swappable<T>::value)
3597 #endif
3598  {
3599  using std::swap;
3600  if ((has_value() == true) && (other.has_value() == true)) {
3601  swap(**this, *other);
3602  } else if ((has_value() == false) && (other.has_value() == true)) {
3603  initialize(std11::move(*other));
3604  other.reset();
3605  } else if ((has_value() == true) && (other.has_value() == false)) {
3606  other.initialize(std11::move(**this));
3607  reset();
3608  }
3609  }
3610 
3611  // x.x.3.5, observers
3612 
3613  optional_constexpr value_type const *operator->() const {
3614  return assert(has_value()), contained.value_ptr();
3615  }
3616 
3617  optional_constexpr14 value_type *operator->() {
3618  return assert(has_value()), contained.value_ptr();
3619  }
3620 
3621  optional_constexpr value_type const &operator*() const optional_ref_qual {
3622  return assert(has_value()), contained.value();
3623  }
3624 
3625  optional_constexpr14 value_type &operator*() optional_ref_qual {
3626  return assert(has_value()), contained.value();
3627  }
3628 
3629 #if optional_HAVE(REF_QUALIFIER)
3630 
3631  optional_constexpr value_type const &&operator*() const optional_refref_qual {
3632  return std::move(**this);
3633  }
3634 
3635  optional_constexpr14 value_type &&operator*() optional_refref_qual { return std::move(**this); }
3636 
3637 #endif
3638 
3639 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3640  optional_constexpr explicit operator bool() const optional_noexcept { return has_value(); }
3641 #else
3642  optional_constexpr operator safe_bool() const optional_noexcept {
3643  return has_value() ? &optional::this_type_does_not_support_comparisons : 0;
3644  }
3645 #endif
3646 
3647  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( modernize-use-nodiscard )
3648  /*optional_nodiscard*/ optional_constexpr bool has_value() const optional_noexcept {
3649  return has_value_;
3650  }
3651 
3652  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( modernize-use-nodiscard )
3653  /*optional_nodiscard*/ optional_constexpr14 value_type const &value() const optional_ref_qual {
3654 #if optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3655  assert(has_value());
3656 #else
3657  if (!has_value()) {
3658  throw bad_optional_access();
3659  }
3660 #endif
3661  return contained.value();
3662  }
3663 
3664  optional_constexpr14 value_type &value() optional_ref_qual {
3665 #if optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3666  assert(has_value());
3667 #else
3668  if (!has_value()) {
3669  throw bad_optional_access();
3670  }
3671 #endif
3672  return contained.value();
3673  }
3674 
3675 #if optional_HAVE(REF_QUALIFIER) && \
3676  (!optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION || optional_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION >= 490)
3677 
3678  // NOLINTNEXTLINE( modernize-use-nodiscard )
3679  /*optional_nodiscard*/ optional_constexpr value_type const &&value() const optional_refref_qual {
3680  return std::move(value());
3681  }
3682 
3683  optional_constexpr14 value_type &&value() optional_refref_qual { return std::move(value()); }
3684 
3685 #endif
3686 
3687 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3688 
3689  template <typename U> optional_constexpr value_type value_or(U &&v) const optional_ref_qual {
3690  return has_value() ? contained.value() : static_cast<T>(std::forward<U>(v));
3691  }
3692 
3693  template <typename U> optional_constexpr14 value_type value_or(U &&v) optional_refref_qual {
3694  return has_value() ? std::move(contained.value()) : static_cast<T>(std::forward<U>(v));
3695  }
3696 
3697 #else
3698 
3699  template <typename U> optional_constexpr value_type value_or(U const &v) const {
3700  return has_value() ? contained.value() : static_cast<value_type>(v);
3701  }
3702 
3703 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3704 
3705  // x.x.3.6, modifiers
3706 
3707  void reset() optional_noexcept {
3708  if (has_value()) {
3709  contained.destruct_value();
3710  }
3711 
3712  has_value_ = false;
3713  }
3714 
3715 private:
3716  void this_type_does_not_support_comparisons() const {}
3717 
3718  template <typename V> void initialize(V const &value) {
3719  assert(!has_value());
3720  contained.construct_value(value);
3721  has_value_ = true;
3722  }
3723 
3724 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3725  template <typename V> void initialize(V &&value) {
3726  assert(!has_value());
3727  contained.construct_value(std::move(value));
3728  has_value_ = true;
3729  }
3730 
3731 #endif
3732 
3733 private:
3734  bool has_value_;
3735  detail::storage_t<value_type> contained;
3736 };
3737 
3738 // Relational operators
3739 
3740 template <typename T, typename U>
3741 inline optional_constexpr bool operator==(optional<T> const &x, optional<U> const &y) {
3742  return bool(x) != bool(y) ? false : !bool(x) ? true : *x == *y;
3743 }
3744 
3745 template <typename T, typename U>
3746 inline optional_constexpr bool operator!=(optional<T> const &x, optional<U> const &y) {
3747  return !(x == y);
3748 }
3749 
3750 template <typename T, typename U>
3751 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<(optional<T> const &x, optional<U> const &y) {
3752  return (!y) ? false : (!x) ? true : *x < *y;
3753 }
3754 
3755 template <typename T, typename U>
3756 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>(optional<T> const &x, optional<U> const &y) {
3757  return (y < x);
3758 }
3759 
3760 template <typename T, typename U>
3761 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<=(optional<T> const &x, optional<U> const &y) {
3762  return !(y < x);
3763 }
3764 
3765 template <typename T, typename U>
3766 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>=(optional<T> const &x, optional<U> const &y) {
3767  return !(x < y);
3768 }
3769 
3770 // Comparison with nullopt
3771 
3772 template <typename T>
3773 inline optional_constexpr bool operator==(optional<T> const &x,
3774  nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3775  return (!x);
3776 }
3777 
3778 template <typename T>
3779 inline optional_constexpr bool operator==(nullopt_t /*unused*/,
3780  optional<T> const &x) optional_noexcept {
3781  return (!x);
3782 }
3783 
3784 template <typename T>
3785 inline optional_constexpr bool operator!=(optional<T> const &x,
3786  nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3787  return bool(x);
3788 }
3789 
3790 template <typename T>
3791 inline optional_constexpr bool operator!=(nullopt_t /*unused*/,
3792  optional<T> const &x) optional_noexcept {
3793  return bool(x);
3794 }
3795 
3796 template <typename T>
3797 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<(optional<T> const & /*unused*/,
3798  nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3799  return false;
3800 }
3801 
3802 template <typename T>
3803 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<(nullopt_t /*unused*/,
3804  optional<T> const &x) optional_noexcept {
3805  return bool(x);
3806 }
3807 
3808 template <typename T>
3809 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<=(optional<T> const &x,
3810  nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3811  return (!x);
3812 }
3813 
3814 template <typename T>
3815 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<=(nullopt_t /*unused*/,
3816  optional<T> const & /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3817  return true;
3818 }
3819 
3820 template <typename T>
3821 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>(optional<T> const &x,
3822  nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3823  return bool(x);
3824 }
3825 
3826 template <typename T>
3827 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>(nullopt_t /*unused*/,
3828  optional<T> const & /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3829  return false;
3830 }
3831 
3832 template <typename T>
3833 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>=(optional<T> const & /*unused*/,
3834  nullopt_t /*unused*/) optional_noexcept {
3835  return true;
3836 }
3837 
3838 template <typename T>
3839 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>=(nullopt_t /*unused*/,
3840  optional<T> const &x) optional_noexcept {
3841  return (!x);
3842 }
3843 
3844 // Comparison with T
3845 
3846 template <typename T, typename U>
3847 inline optional_constexpr bool operator==(optional<T> const &x, U const &v) {
3848  return bool(x) ? *x == v : false;
3849 }
3850 
3851 template <typename T, typename U>
3852 inline optional_constexpr bool operator==(U const &v, optional<T> const &x) {
3853  return bool(x) ? v == *x : false;
3854 }
3855 
3856 template <typename T, typename U>
3857 inline optional_constexpr bool operator!=(optional<T> const &x, U const &v) {
3858  return bool(x) ? *x != v : true;
3859 }
3860 
3861 template <typename T, typename U>
3862 inline optional_constexpr bool operator!=(U const &v, optional<T> const &x) {
3863  return bool(x) ? v != *x : true;
3864 }
3865 
3866 template <typename T, typename U>
3867 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<(optional<T> const &x, U const &v) {
3868  return bool(x) ? *x < v : true;
3869 }
3870 
3871 template <typename T, typename U>
3872 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<(U const &v, optional<T> const &x) {
3873  return bool(x) ? v < *x : false;
3874 }
3875 
3876 template <typename T, typename U>
3877 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<=(optional<T> const &x, U const &v) {
3878  return bool(x) ? *x <= v : true;
3879 }
3880 
3881 template <typename T, typename U>
3882 inline optional_constexpr bool operator<=(U const &v, optional<T> const &x) {
3883  return bool(x) ? v <= *x : false;
3884 }
3885 
3886 template <typename T, typename U>
3887 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>(optional<T> const &x, U const &v) {
3888  return bool(x) ? *x > v : false;
3889 }
3890 
3891 template <typename T, typename U>
3892 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>(U const &v, optional<T> const &x) {
3893  return bool(x) ? v > *x : true;
3894 }
3895 
3896 template <typename T, typename U>
3897 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>=(optional<T> const &x, U const &v) {
3898  return bool(x) ? *x >= v : false;
3899 }
3900 
3901 template <typename T, typename U>
3902 inline optional_constexpr bool operator>=(U const &v, optional<T> const &x) {
3903  return bool(x) ? v >= *x : true;
3904 }
3905 
3906 // Specialized algorithms
3907 
3908 template <
3909  typename T
3910 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3911  optional_REQUIRES_T(std::is_move_constructible<T>::value &&std17::is_swappable<T>::value)
3912 #endif
3913  >
3914 void swap(optional<T> &x, optional<T> &y)
3915 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3916  noexcept(noexcept(x.swap(y)))
3917 #endif
3918 {
3919  x.swap(y);
3920 }
3921 
3922 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3923 
3924 template <typename T>
3925 optional_constexpr optional<typename std::decay<T>::type> make_optional(T &&value) {
3926  return optional<typename std::decay<T>::type>(std::forward<T>(value));
3927 }
3928 
3929 template <typename T, typename... Args>
3930 optional_constexpr optional<T> make_optional(Args &&... args) {
3931  return optional<T>(nonstd_lite_in_place(T), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3932 }
3933 
3934 template <typename T, typename U, typename... Args>
3935 optional_constexpr optional<T> make_optional(std::initializer_list<U> il, Args &&... args) {
3936  return optional<T>(nonstd_lite_in_place(T), il, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
3937 }
3938 
3939 #else
3940 
3941 template <typename T> optional<T> make_optional(T const &value) { return optional<T>(value); }
3942 
3943 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3944 
3945 } // namespace optional_lite
3946 
3947 using optional_lite::nullopt;
3948 using optional_lite::nullopt_t;
3949 using optional_lite::optional;
3950 
3951 #if !optional_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3952 using optional_lite::bad_optional_access;
3953 #endif
3954 
3955 using optional_lite::make_optional;
3956 
3957 } // namespace nonstd
3958 
3959 #if optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3960 
3961 // specialize the std::hash algorithm:
3962 
3963 namespace std {
3964 
3965 template <class T> struct hash<nonstd::optional<T>> {
3966 public:
3967  std::size_t operator()(nonstd::optional<T> const &v) const optional_noexcept {
3968  return bool(v) ? std::hash<T>{}(*v) : 0;
3969  }
3970 };
3971 
3972 } // namespace std
3973 
3974 #endif // optional_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3975 
3976 #if defined(__clang__)
3977 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
3978 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
3979 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
3980 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
3981 #pragma warning(pop)
3982 #endif
3983 
3984 #endif // optional_USES_STD_OPTIONAL
3985 
3986 #endif // NONSTD_OPTIONAL_LITE_HPP
3997 
3998 #ifndef TERMCOLOR_HPP_
3999 #define TERMCOLOR_HPP_
4000 
4001 // the following snippet of code detects the current OS and
4002 // defines the appropriate macro that is used to wrap some
4003 // platform specific things
4004 #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64)
4005 #define TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS
4006 #elif defined(__APPLE__)
4007 #define TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS
4008 #elif defined(__unix__) || defined(__unix)
4009 #define TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX
4010 #else
4011 #error unsupported platform
4012 #endif
4013 
4014 // This headers provides the `isatty()`/`fileno()` functions,
4015 // which are used for testing whether a standart stream refers
4016 // to the terminal. As for Windows, we also need WinApi funcs
4017 // for changing colors attributes of the terminal.
4018 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4019 #include <unistd.h>
4020 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4021 #include <io.h>
4022 #include <windows.h>
4023 #endif
4024 
4025 #include <cstdio>
4026 #include <iostream>
4027 
4028 namespace termcolor {
4029 // Forward declaration of the `_internal` namespace.
4030 // All comments are below.
4031 namespace _internal {
4032 // An index to be used to access a private storage of I/O streams. See
4033 // colorize / nocolorize I/O manipulators for details.
4034 static int colorize_index = std::ios_base::xalloc();
4035 
4036 inline FILE *get_standard_stream(const std::ostream &stream);
4037 inline bool is_colorized(std::ostream &stream);
4038 inline bool is_atty(const std::ostream &stream);
4039 
4040 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4041 inline void win_change_attributes(std::ostream &stream, int foreground, int background = -1);
4042 #endif
4043 } // namespace _internal
4044 
4045 inline std::ostream &colorize(std::ostream &stream) {
4046  stream.iword(_internal::colorize_index) = 1L;
4047  return stream;
4048 }
4049 
4050 inline std::ostream &nocolorize(std::ostream &stream) {
4051  stream.iword(_internal::colorize_index) = 0L;
4052  return stream;
4053 }
4054 
4055 inline std::ostream &reset(std::ostream &stream) {
4056  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4057 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4058  stream << "\033[00m";
4059 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4060  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, -1);
4061 #endif
4062  }
4063  return stream;
4064 }
4065 
4066 inline std::ostream &bold(std::ostream &stream) {
4067  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4068 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4069  stream << "\033[1m";
4070 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4071 #endif
4072  }
4073  return stream;
4074 }
4075 
4076 inline std::ostream &dark(std::ostream &stream) {
4077  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4078 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4079  stream << "\033[2m";
4080 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4081 #endif
4082  }
4083  return stream;
4084 }
4085 
4086 inline std::ostream &italic(std::ostream &stream) {
4087  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4088 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4089  stream << "\033[3m";
4090 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4091 #endif
4092  }
4093  return stream;
4094 }
4095 
4096 inline std::ostream &underline(std::ostream &stream) {
4097  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4098 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4099  stream << "\033[4m";
4100 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4101 #endif
4102  }
4103  return stream;
4104 }
4105 
4106 inline std::ostream &blink(std::ostream &stream) {
4107  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4108 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4109  stream << "\033[5m";
4110 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4111 #endif
4112  }
4113  return stream;
4114 }
4115 
4116 inline std::ostream &reverse(std::ostream &stream) {
4117  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4118 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4119  stream << "\033[7m";
4120 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4121 #endif
4122  }
4123  return stream;
4124 }
4125 
4126 inline std::ostream &concealed(std::ostream &stream) {
4127  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4128 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4129  stream << "\033[8m";
4130 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4131 #endif
4132  }
4133  return stream;
4134 }
4135 
4136 inline std::ostream &crossed(std::ostream &stream) {
4137  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4138 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4139  stream << "\033[9m";
4140 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4141 #endif
4142  }
4143  return stream;
4144 }
4145 
4146 inline std::ostream &grey(std::ostream &stream) {
4147  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4148 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4149  stream << "\033[30m";
4150 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4151  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream,
4152  0 // grey (black)
4153  );
4154 #endif
4155  }
4156  return stream;
4157 }
4158 
4159 inline std::ostream &red(std::ostream &stream) {
4160  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4161 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4162  stream << "\033[31m";
4163 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4164  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_RED);
4165 #endif
4166  }
4167  return stream;
4168 }
4169 
4170 inline std::ostream &green(std::ostream &stream) {
4171  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4172 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4173  stream << "\033[32m";
4174 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4175  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_GREEN);
4176 #endif
4177  }
4178  return stream;
4179 }
4180 
4181 inline std::ostream &yellow(std::ostream &stream) {
4182  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4183 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4184  stream << "\033[33m";
4185 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4186  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED);
4187 #endif
4188  }
4189  return stream;
4190 }
4191 
4192 inline std::ostream &blue(std::ostream &stream) {
4193  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4194 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4195  stream << "\033[34m";
4196 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4197  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_BLUE);
4198 #endif
4199  }
4200  return stream;
4201 }

4204  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4205 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4206  stream << "\033[35m";
4207 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4208  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_RED);
4209 #endif
4210  }
4211  return stream;
4212 }

4214 inline std::ostream &cyan(std::ostream &stream) {
4215  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4216 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4217  stream << "\033[36m";
4218 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4219  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN);
4220 #endif
4221  }
4222  return stream;
4223 }
4224 
4225 inline std::ostream &white(std::ostream &stream) {
4226  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4227 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4228  stream << "\033[37m";
4229 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4230  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED);
4231 #endif
4232  }
4233  return stream;
4234 }
4235 
4236 inline std::ostream &on_grey(std::ostream &stream) {
4237  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4238 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4239  stream << "\033[40m";
4240 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4241  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1,
4242  0 // grey (black)
4243  );
4244 #endif
4245  }
4246  return stream;
4247 }
4248 
4249 inline std::ostream &on_red(std::ostream &stream) {
4250  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4251 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4252  stream << "\033[41m";
4253 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4254  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, BACKGROUND_RED);
4255 #endif
4256  }
4257  return stream;
4258 }

4260 inline std::ostream &on_green(std::ostream &stream) {
4261  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4262 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4263  stream << "\033[42m";
4264 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4265  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, BACKGROUND_GREEN);
4266 #endif
4267  }
4268  return stream;
4269 }

4272  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4273 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4274  stream << "\033[43m";
4275 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4276  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED);
4277 #endif
4278  }
4279  return stream;
4280 }

4283  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4284 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4285  stream << "\033[44m";
4286 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4287  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, BACKGROUND_BLUE);
4288 #endif
4289  }
4290  return stream;
4291 }

4294  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4295 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4296  stream << "\033[45m";
4297 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4298  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_RED);
4299 #endif
4300  }
4301  return stream;
4302 }

4304 inline std::ostream &on_cyan(std::ostream &stream) {
4305  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4306 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4307  stream << "\033[46m";
4308 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4309  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1, BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_BLUE);
4310 #endif
4311  }
4312  return stream;
4313 }
4314 
4315 inline std::ostream &on_white(std::ostream &stream) {
4316  if (_internal::is_colorized(stream)) {
4317 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4318  stream << "\033[47m";
4319 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4320  _internal::win_change_attributes(stream, -1,
4321  BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_RED);
4322 #endif
4323  }
4324 
4325  return stream;
4326 }
4327 
4332 namespace _internal {
4336 inline FILE *get_standard_stream(const std::ostream &stream) {
4337  if (&stream == &std::cout)
4338  return stdout;
4339  else if ((&stream == &std::cerr) || (&stream == &std::clog))
4340  return stderr;
4341 
4342  return 0;
4343 }
4344 
4345 // Say whether a given stream should be colorized or not. It's always
4346 // true for ATTY streams and may be true for streams marked with
4347 // colorize flag.
4348 inline bool is_colorized(std::ostream &stream) {
4349  return is_atty(stream) || static_cast<bool>(stream.iword(colorize_index));
4350 }
4351 
4354 inline bool is_atty(const std::ostream &stream) {
4355  FILE *std_stream = get_standard_stream(stream);
4356 
4357  // Unfortunately, fileno() ends with segmentation fault
4358  // if invalid file descriptor is passed. So we need to
4359  // handle this case gracefully and assume it's not a tty
4360  // if standard stream is not detected, and 0 is returned.
4361  if (!std_stream)
4362  return false;
4363 
4364 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS) || defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX)
4365  return ::isatty(fileno(std_stream));
4366 #elif defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4367  return ::_isatty(_fileno(std_stream));
4368 #endif
4369 }
4370 
4371 #if defined(TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS)
4374 inline void win_change_attributes(std::ostream &stream, int foreground, int background) {
4375  // yeah, i know.. it's ugly, it's windows.
4376  static WORD defaultAttributes = 0;
4377 
4378  // Windows doesn't have ANSI escape sequences and so we use special
4379  // API to change Terminal output color. That means we can't
4380  // manipulate colors by means of "std::stringstream" and hence
4381  // should do nothing in this case.
4382  if (!_internal::is_atty(stream))
4383  return;
4384 
4385  // get terminal handle
4386  HANDLE hTerminal = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
4387  if (&stream == &std::cout)
4388  hTerminal = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
4389  else if (&stream == &std::cerr)
4390  hTerminal = GetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE);
4391 
4392  // save default terminal attributes if it unsaved
4393  if (!defaultAttributes) {
4394  CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO info;
4395  if (!GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(hTerminal, &info))
4396  return;
4397  defaultAttributes = info.wAttributes;
4398  }
4399 
4400  // restore all default settings
4401  if (foreground == -1 && background == -1) {
4402  SetConsoleTextAttribute(hTerminal, defaultAttributes);
4403  return;
4404  }
4405 
4406  // get current settings
4407  CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO info;
4408  if (!GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(hTerminal, &info))
4409  return;
4410 
4411  if (foreground != -1) {
4412  info.wAttributes &= ~(info.wAttributes & 0x0F);
4413  info.wAttributes |= static_cast<WORD>(foreground);
4414  }
4415 
4416  if (background != -1) {
4417  info.wAttributes &= ~(info.wAttributes & 0xF0);
4418  info.wAttributes |= static_cast<WORD>(background);
4419  }
4420 
4421  SetConsoleTextAttribute(hTerminal, info.wAttributes);
4422 }
4423 #endif // TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS
4424 
4425 } // namespace _internal
4426 
4427 } // namespace termcolor
4428 
4429 #undef TERMCOLOR_OS_WINDOWS
4430 #undef TERMCOLOR_OS_MACOS
4431 #undef TERMCOLOR_OS_LINUX
4432 
4433 #endif // TERMCOLOR_HPP_
4434 
4435 /*
4436  __ ___. .__ __
4437 _/ |______ \_ |__ __ __| | _____ _/ |_ ____
4438 \ __\__ \ | __ \| | \ | \__ \\ __\/ __ \
4439  | | / __ \| \_\ \ | / |__/ __ \| | \ ___/
4440  |__| (____ /___ /____/|____(____ /__| \___ >
4441  \/ \/ \/ \/
4442 Table Maker for Modern C++
4443 https://github.com/p-ranav/tabulate

4454 furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

4461 FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE

4467 #pragma once
4468 #include <algorithm>
4469 #include <cstdint>
4470 #include <string>
4471 
4472 #include <clocale>
4473 #include <locale>
4474 
4475 #include <cstdlib>
4476 // #include <tabulate/termcolor.hpp>
4477 #include <wchar.h>
4478 
4479 namespace tabulate {
4480 
4481 #if defined(__unix__) || defined(__unix) || defined(__APPLE__)
4482 inline int get_wcswidth(const std::string &string, const std::string &locale,
4483  size_t max_column_width) {
4484  if (string.size() == 0)
4485  return 0;
4486 
4487  // The behavior of wcswidth() depends on the LC_CTYPE category of the current locale.
4488  // Set the current locale based on cell properties before computing width
4489  auto old_locale = std::locale::global(std::locale(locale));
4490 
4491  // Convert from narrow std::string to wide string
4492  wchar_t *wide_string = new wchar_t[string.size()];
4493  std::mbstowcs(wide_string, string.c_str(), string.size());
4494 
4495  // Compute display width of wide string
4496  int result = wcswidth(wide_string, max_column_width);
4497  delete[] wide_string;
4498 
4499  // Restore old locale
4500  std::locale::global(old_locale);
4501 
4502  return result;
4503 }
4504 #endif
4505 
4506 inline size_t get_sequence_length(const std::string &text, const std::string &locale,
4507  bool is_multi_byte_character_support_enabled) {
4508  if (!is_multi_byte_character_support_enabled)
4509  return text.length();
4510 
4511 #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64)
4512  return (text.length() - std::count_if(text.begin(), text.end(),
4513  [](char c) -> bool { return (c & 0xC0) == 0x80; }));
4514 #elif defined(__unix__) || defined(__unix) || defined(__APPLE__)
4515  auto result = get_wcswidth(text, locale, text.size());
4516  if (result >= 0)
4517  return result;
4518  else
4519  return (text.length() - std::count_if(text.begin(), text.end(),
4520  [](char c) -> bool { return (c & 0xC0) == 0x80; }));
4521 #endif
4522 }
4523 
4524 } // namespace tabulate
4525

4736 class Format {
4737 public:
4738  Format &width(size_t value) {
4739  width_ = value;
4740  return *this;
4741  }
4742 
4743  Format &height(size_t value) {
4744  height_ = value;
4745  return *this;
4746  }
4747 
4748  Format &padding(size_t value) {
4749  padding_left_ = value;
4750  padding_right_ = value;
4751  padding_top_ = value;
4752  padding_bottom_ = value;
4753  return *this;
4754  }
4755 
4756  Format &padding_left(size_t value) {
4757  padding_left_ = value;
4758  return *this;
4759  }
4760 
4761  Format &padding_right(size_t value) {
4762  padding_right_ = value;
4763  return *this;
4764  }
4765 
4766  Format &padding_top(size_t value) {
4767  padding_top_ = value;
4768  return *this;
4769  }
4770 
4771  Format &padding_bottom(size_t value) {
4772  padding_bottom_ = value;
4773  return *this;
4774  }
4775 
4776  Format &border(const std::string &value) {
4777  border_left_ = value;
4778  border_right_ = value;
4779  border_top_ = value;
4780  border_bottom_ = value;
4781  return *this;
4782  }
4783 
4784  Format &border_color(Color value) {
4785  border_left_color_ = value;
4786  border_right_color_ = value;
4787  border_top_color_ = value;
4788  border_bottom_color_ = value;
4789  return *this;
4790  }
4791 
4792  Format &border_background_color(Color value) {
4793  border_left_background_color_ = value;
4794  border_right_background_color_ = value;
4795  border_top_background_color_ = value;
4796  border_bottom_background_color_ = value;
4797  return *this;
4798  }
4799 
4800  Format &border_left(const std::string &value) {
4801  border_left_ = value;
4802  return *this;
4803  }
4804 
4805  Format &border_left_color(Color value) {
4806  border_left_color_ = value;
4807  return *this;
4808  }
4809

4817  return *this;

4828  }

4833  }

4838  }

4843  }

4848  }

4851  border_bottom_color_ = value;
4852  return *this;
4853  }
4854 
4855  Format &border_bottom_background_color(Color value) {
4856  border_bottom_background_color_ = value;
4857  return *this;
4858  }
4859 
4860  Format &show_border() {
4861  show_border_top_ = true;
4862  show_border_bottom_ = true;
4863  show_border_left_ = true;
4864  show_border_right_ = true;
4865  return *this;
4866  }
4867 
4868  Format &hide_border() {
4869  show_border_top_ = false;
4870  show_border_bottom_ = false;
4871  show_border_left_ = false;
4872  show_border_right_ = false;
4873  return *this;
4874  }
4875 
4876  Format &show_border_top() {
4877  show_border_top_ = true;
4878  return *this;
4879  }
4880 
4881  Format &hide_border_top() {
4882  show_border_top_ = false;
4883  return *this;
4884  }
4885 
4886  Format &show_border_bottom() {
4887  show_border_bottom_ = true;
4888  return *this;
4889  }
4890 
4891  Format &hide_border_bottom() {
4892  show_border_bottom_ = false;
4893  return *this;
4894  }
4895 
4896  Format &show_border_left() {
4897  show_border_left_ = true;
4898  return *this;
4899  }
4900 
4901  Format &hide_border_left() {
4902  show_border_left_ = false;
4903  return *this;
4904  }
4905 
4906  Format &show_border_right() {
4907  show_border_right_ = true;
4908  return *this;
4909  }
4910 
4911  Format &hide_border_right() {
4912  show_border_right_ = false;
4913  return *this;
4914  }
4915

4917  corner_top_left_ = value;
4918  corner_top_right_ = value;
4919  corner_bottom_left_ = value;
4920  corner_bottom_right_ = value;
4921  return *this;
4922  }

4927  corner_bottom_left_color_ = value;
4928  corner_bottom_right_color_ = value;
4929  return *this;
4930  }
4931 
4932  Format &corner_background_color(Color value) {
4933  corner_top_left_background_color_ = value;
4934  corner_top_right_background_color_ = value;
4935  corner_bottom_left_background_color_ = value;
4936  corner_bottom_right_background_color_ = value;
4937  return *this;
4938  }

4941  corner_top_left_ = value;
4942  return *this;
4943  }
4944 
4945  Format &corner_top_left_color(Color value) {
4946  corner_top_left_color_ = value;
4947  return *this;
4948  }
4949
